title: Fox Reporter Opens Up About Her Heartbreaking Diagnosis
text:
Fox Reporter Opens Up About Her Heartbreaking Diagnosis "Trust your intuition..." Share on Facebook Share Tweet Email Email Print Advertisement - story continues below 
After receiving news that she will be unable to have children, Fox News journalist Diana Falzone , 33, told the Daily Mail she was “inconsolable.” 
Having received news of her condition only a few days after her birthday last year, Falzone is now sharing her story to raise awareness for other women. 
The cause of Falzone’s infertility is a disease called endometriosis. Advertisement - story continues below Tucker Carlson Gives Huge Boost To Fox Ratings Over Kelly 
“I had heard of endometriosis but was not aware of how much of an impact it could have on one’s body, let alone possible infertility,” said Falzone. 
Falzone reported that after experiencing symptoms of intense pain and heavy bleeding in February, she went to the emergency room but the hospital staff were unsuccessful in diagnosing her condition. 
Her gynecologist was also unable to determine the cause of her illness, so Falzone made an appointment with a specialist. Advertisement - story continues below 
The specialist detected a “mass” in her uterus, which would require surgery and an egg reserve blood test before being able to determine whether or not she would be able to have children. 
“As she delivered the news, my heart raced and my legs shook,” said Falzone. 
Falzone added that the expertise and quality care of her “Earth angels,” a team of doctors including Dr. Andrea Vidali, Dr. Jeffrey Braverman and Dr. Mutahar Ahmed, are the reason she escaped having a hysterectomy. 
When Falzone posted the incident on Facebook, her friends and family were quick to show their support. Advertisement - story continues below New Poll Shows Most Americans Support Trump’s Speech 
One Facebook follower wrote, “Wow…. Very Powerful Diana…&& Very Brave to share such a personal story!!! Reading it, I could feel your emotion in the article!! Here’s Hoping for the Best for u going forward!! God Bless.” 
Another posted, “Diana — you are amazing!! Thank you for sharing your story. I love you and am proud to be your sis. Your strength inspires me.” 
Twitter followers were also supportive of Falzone, wishing her health and happiness. @dianafalzone I was sorry to hear about this, Diana. Good of you to speak out and open up. Discussions are always better than silence. 
— Logical Libertarian™ (@LgclLibertarian) January 26, 2017 @dianafalzone I pray for you! With God, all things are possible!! 
— Will (@adjutant171) January 26, 2017 
Falzone said she is opening up about her story to urge women to “trust your intuition.” 
“If you have symptoms of endometriosis, do not be afraid to advocate for yourself. Trust your intuition and seek out a specialist. Remember, not all medical practitioners are well-versed with the signs of this disease,” said Falzone. 
The young reporter has said she is considering adoption. 
“I strongly believe a child chooses you. If I’m meant to have a child biologically I will. If not, there are many children that need loving, supportive homes and when and if that time comes I would welcome that,” she told Daily Mail Online. What do you think? Scroll down to comment below.
